<<<<<<< HEAD
Master Geree's Case of conscience sifted Wherein is enquired, vvhether the King (considering his oath at coronation to protect the clergy and their priviledges) can with a safe conscience consent to the abrogation of episcopacy. By Edward Boughen. D.D. Mr. Gerees Case of conscience sifted. Boughen, Edward, 1587?-1660?
[8], 71, 70-141, [1] p.
[s.n.], London : printed in the yeare, 1650.
An edition of: Boughen, Edward. Mr. Gerees Case of conscience sifted. A reply to: Geree, John. A case of conscience resolved. Text is continuous despite pagination. Reproduction of the original in the Congretional Library, London.
=======
